alert.note: Alert for Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 10:30AM EDT until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Alabama...Georgia... Chattahoochee River at 14th Street at Columbus affecting Lee, Muscogee, Russell and Chattahoochee Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville affecting Troup County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Yellowjacket Creek at Hammett Rd below Hogansville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the marshy wetlands and woods along the creek upstream and downstream from the stream gage on the Hammett Road bridge. Yards of nearby homes will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EDT Tuesday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
